title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: A sample quiz covering various topics including science, history, and literature.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: Who wrote the novel '1984'?
questions.explanation: George Orwell wrote '1984', a dystopian novel published in 1949.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: The Blue Whale is the largest mammal and the largest animal ever known to have lived on Earth.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan in September.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Au is the chemical symbol for gold, derived from the Latin word 'aurum'.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean basin on Earth.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa between 1503 and 1519.

questions.question: What is the smallest prime number?
questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest prime number and the only even prime number.

questions.question: Which gas makes up most of Earth's atmosphere?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

questions.question: Who composed 'The Four Seasons'?
questions.explanation: Antonio Vivaldi composed 'The Four Seasons', a set of four violin concertos.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the hardest naturally occurring substance known.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, who is the king of the gods?
questions.explanation: Zeus is the king of the gods in Greek mythology, ruler of Mount Olympus.

questions.question: What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: The exact speed of light in a vacuum is 299,792,458 meters per second.

questions.question: Which continent has the most countries?
questions.explanation: Africa has 54 recognized sovereign states, more than any other continent.
